intro: Senecio boquetensis, commonly known as the Boquet's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
